title: Early language services for children who are deaf, hard of hearing, or deaf-blind
context: [§321-352.2] Early language services for children who are deaf, hard of hearing, or deaf-blind. Early intervention services for infants and toddlers may include, but not be limited to, service providers and mentors of the deaf, hard of hearing, or deaf-blind who use American Sign Language; service providers and mentors of the deaf who use oral language; American Sign Language teachers for families of young children; family-to-family support; and training of early intervention providers. [L 2016, c 177, §2] Note Working group on age-appropriate development for children from birth to age five years who are deaf, hard of hearing, or deaf-blind; reports to 2017-2018 legislature (ceases to exist June 30, 2018). L 2016, c 177, §3.
